bioghist.p: Makepeace Uho Tsao received Ph.D. in Pharmacological Chemistry from the University of Michigan in 1944 and worked at the University of Michigan Pediatric Research Lab and served as assistant and associate professor of Biochemistry in the School of Medicine, as well as clinically at the University hospital. He later taught at the University of California at Davis. While teaching at the University of Michigan in the early 1960s, Tsao became associated with the avant-garde arts group ONCE. The ONCE Group was founded by Ann Arbor artists Robert Ashley, George Cacioppo, Gordon Mumma, Roger Reynolds, and Donald Scavarda. It included musicians, visual artists, architects, and film-makers. The group created the ONCE Festival of music that became an arena for avant-garde and experimental acoustic and electronic music performances in the late 1950s-early 1960s.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two folders of color and black and white posters, flyers, advertisements, programs, mailing cards, etc., announcing events of the ONCE Festival performances and activities. The items are arranged in chronological order, except for two extra-large items separately located in a second folder.
